<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file performs vector type splitting and scalarization for LegalizeTypes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Scalarization is the act of changing a computation in an illegal one-element</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// vector type to be a computation in its scalar element type.  For example,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// implementing &lt;1 x f32&gt; arithmetic in a scalar f32 register.  This is needed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// as a base case when scalarizing vector arithmetic like &lt;4 x f32&gt;, which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// eventually decomposes to scalars if the target doesn&#39;t support v4f32 or v2f32</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// types.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Splitting is the act of changing a computation in an invalid vector type to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// be a computation in two vectors of half the size.  For example, implementing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &lt;128 x f32&gt; operations in terms of two &lt;64 x f32&gt; operations.</span></CodeLine>
